meanings.definition: The act of intercepting or stopping something from reaching its intended destination.
meanings.sent1: The football player made two interceptions during the game.
meanings.sent2: The police made several interceptions to prevent the criminals from escaping.
meanings.sent3: The cat's playful interception of the toy mouse amused everyone in the room.
meanings.sent4: Her quick interception of the falling vase saved it from shattering on the floor.
meanings.sent5: The interception of the package by the neighbor made sure it reached the right house.

meanings.definition: The act of catching or seizing something that is in motion.
meanings.sent1: The basketball player's interceptions helped his team gain possession of the ball.
meanings.sent2: The security guard made an interception of the thief before he could escape.
meanings.sent3: The interception of the flying frisbee by the dog was quite impressive.
meanings.sent4: Her interception of the falling book saved it from hitting the ground.
meanings.sent5: The interception of the runaway balloon prevented it from floating away.

meanings.definition: The act of secretly listening to or recording a communication.
meanings.sent1: The spy's interceptions of enemy messages were crucial for the mission.
meanings.sent2: The interception of the phone call revealed important information.
meanings.sent3: The interception of the whispered conversation by the eavesdropper surprised him.
meanings.sent4: Her interception of the coded message helped decipher the secret plan.
meanings.sent5: The interception of the radio transmission exposed the enemy's location.
